json.text: My name is Lamprini and I graduated from BA Photography.
area we have two black-and-white darkrooms and one colour darkroom. We use the
facilities to experiment mostly but also for final work for projects, anything, but
I like to think that it's a lot for experimentation and to improve your
knowledge and your skills in photography. You start from the foundation of
photography from the analog perspective, so we have the processing area which you
can come and process your film, black and white and colour, then you come in print in
the darkroom area, if you want if you want to try black and white printing, or
if you want to try colour printing. LCC is unique because we have a team of
technicians that are specialised only for the photography students and they help
you out with your work, if you're struggling, if you're not sure how to use
equipment, if you're not sure how to use the darkroom for example, they will be
there to help you out and make sure that you know exactly what
you're doing and they also run the workshops across the photography
